availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Atwood Gaines Hobson (Warren County, Kentucky, clerk of court, banker, and soldier)

body.p: Warren County, Kentucky, clerk of court, banker, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married Julia Ann Van Meter Hobson on November 23, 1836. Father of Mary E. Hobson, William E. Hobson, Jonathan Hobson, and Joseph V. Hobson. Clerk of court in Warren County in 1850. Owned five enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Banker in Warren County in 1860. Owned twenty-one enslaved persons in Warren County in 1860. Served in the Union Army as colonel in 1862.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 35A-35B.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 1, p. 10.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 4-5.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, District 2, p. 3.
Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Warren County, Bowling Green, p. 18.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000164003, p. 180.
Find A Grave, "Atwood Gaines Hobson (1815-1898)," Memorial #28020359, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/28020359/atwood-gaines-hobson# (accessed December 31, 2018).
